meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a firm blow
meanings.sent1: He smites the nail with the hammer.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith smites the red-hot iron.
meanings.sent3: The knight smites the dragon with his sword.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm smites the old oak tree with lightning.
meanings.sent5: The warrior smites his enemy in battle.

meanings.definition: To afflict or attack with a disease or disaster
meanings.sent1: The plague smites the village, spreading fear.
meanings.sent2: Natural disasters can smite entire regions.
meanings.sent3: The flu bug smites the office, leaving many sick.
meanings.sent4: Misfortune smites unexpectedly, like a bolt from the blue.
meanings.sent5: The curse of darkness smites the land with eternal night.

meanings.definition: To impress or affect strongly with a feeling or emotion
meanings.sent1: The beauty of the sunset smites him with awe.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness smites everyone who meets her.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's cuteness smites even the grumpiest person.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song smites the heart with nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The tragedy in the story smites the reader with sorrow.
